page.title: 05How Carlton has changed
page.content: I asked my Gran how Carlton had changed all the time she had lived here she said Carlton square has changed because there used to be a school there named Board school. There was also a factory which did chrome work and there was also a chemist called Mossups and a post office. Southcliffe road was just a cart track with Pearsons farm on it, he used to bring milk round in the cans and there was just a few cottages called New row. Where I live at Campbell Drive there was just lots of alotments, where my great grandad used to work.Where there is the dry play and the football pitches of Carlton forum is there was a footpath and alotments called the Alps. Where the golf range is there used to be a field with a dyke and a swamp,called Russia.
